Netflix's Castlevania is like a dark
fantasy metal album cover come to life
the show begins with the gentle prelude
of Lisa and Jackie Lee's love story
quickly souring after persecution from
the church and Dracula's subsequent
promise of vengeance before finally
evolving into a magnificent procession
of violence and despair together the
vampire hunter Trevor Belmont the
magician Sipho and Dracula's estranged
son Alucard will travel to the vampires
castle and battle for the fate of
humanity
this makes Netflix's Castlevania a
reasonably faithful adaptation of
Castlevania 3 Dracula's curse and you'd
be hard-pressed to find a higher quality
video game adaptation at that
unflinching and gripping violence is one
of the show's strongest pulls it isn't
afraid to dismember disfigure and even
rain blood onto its cast of characters
additionally the action is punctuated by
heavy and impactful sound design which
helps communicate the weight and power
of the fight choreography

this creates an absorbing and

fans of the game series who will
appreciate its references

Bojack horseman is a comedy while a lot
of people say it's about a washed-up
sitcom star who had a show back in the
80s in reality it's a exploration of
depression anxiety and substance abuse
that spans back generations
Bojack can be really goofy and the
situation's can get extremely surreal
well then suddenly just kicking you back
to reality with some sobering facts
about real life
Bojack is nihilistic but unlike shows
like say brick and Morty where the main
characters are in a large vast universe
where nothing matters and you're gonna
die so you might as well do whatever
Bojack is about a depressed individual
who has a negative outlook on the world
but he still wants to get better because
who wants to stew in their own
depression but Bojack often struggles to
climb that hill due to personal and
security and deeply rooted resentment
episodes like season 4 stupid piece of
